His opponent knows the book line.
The usual response.
White goes for quick development instead of the immediate recapture.
5... NxP is considered better.
Centralizing the Knight nicely.
Clearing the way for castling.
White continues his own development.
Black castles at once.
Keeping Black cramped by preventing 8... B-N5. Black intends ...N-Q2, ... B-B3 and ...N/2-K4.
Played with singular lack of judgment. Black should have played 8... N-Q2 immediately.
Now that Black his weakened his KB2, he can no longer move his King Knight from KB3 to Q2. His King-side would be weakened beyond endurance.
Instead of 9... N-K4, which would at least offer temporary relief, Black stumbles into a fatal trap.
White pounces at once.
Forced to avoid material loss.
Another very strong attacking move.
On any other move, Black loses his Queen.
White now forces mate.
Black's only legal move.
A brilliant win for the amateur.
